reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup:** Goon LP, Dual parallel 25g SS316L @ 0.10ohms, 80w power with 100w preheat, 410 degree F temp limit, full cotton wicks

**Testing:** RF (SC) Pomegranate @1.4% Solo 50/50 VG/PG, steeped three days.

**Flavor Description:** This tastes like a sweetened pomegranate. at times it almost feels like the seeds are there somewhere, like a hint of earthiness that is so subtle its almost not worth mentioning. this is a very juicy flavor that almost sticks to my palate and lingers there. the tartness of a real pomegranate isn't very present here, its like putting sugar in a pomegranate puree. no notable texture except juicy. 

**Off-flavors:** none, unless you count the LACK of tartness or added sweetness

**Throat Hit:** nothing noticable, very smooth

**Notes/Suggested Pairings:** first of all i think this would be amazing with some LA Lemonade! or in any kind of fruity drink really... I think the percentage of use will be from 1% as a support for other berries (especially Blueberry or Blackberry) to 2% as a main flavor or lead note. i could see this used in candy mixes, bakeries, drinks, berry blends, etc.

**Second Opinions:** i imagine other people got this during the sale so leave your opinions in the comments please! the Real Flavors site describes this as follows: ["This seasonal fruit is an autumn/winter favorite. Mildly sweet and highly tart, pomegranates make a delicious snack and can be added to savory or dessert-style foods. Drinks like them too! Leave behind the chore of peeling those juicy red seeds out…that’s what we’re here for."](http://www.realflavors.com/shop/pomegranate-super-concentrate/) seems like a description of pomegranates themselves rather than the concentrate. couldn't find any other opinions on this one. 

Edit: changed bitter to tart for accuracy

Edit2: I just wanted to clarify that this is really tasty and juicy. I would recommend trying this!
reviewsJson.author: PerennialPhilosopher
